units.title: Pooling and Dissociation for Single‑Cell Sequencing
units.text: each condition (Supplementary Fig. 1) were pooled and dissociated into single-cell suspensions, followed by cell hashing with barcoded antibodies and processing for single-cell transcriptome sequencing (3′ mRNA, 10x Genomics; Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: Enables multiplexed scRNA‑seq of all treatment conditions.

units.title: Organoid Generation in 96‑Well Plates
units.text: organoids were generated in 96-well plates, where pluripotent stem cells (WTC, H9 and HES3 lines; the latter modified to report the expression of the retinal marker NKX2-1) were aggregated into embryoid bodies and cultured in minimal neural induction media (MNIM) to induce neuroectodermal fates (Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: Creates a standardized platform for downstream morphogen exposure.

units.title: Morphogen Treatment Panel Application
units.text: Developing organoids were then subjected to a panel of morphogen treatments with varying timing, concentration and combination of the molecules CHIR99021 (CHIR, WNT pathway activator), XAV939 (WNT pathway inhibitor), rh‑SHH/CS24II (SHH) and purmorphamine, FGF‑8B (FGF8), RA, rhBMP‑4 (BMP4), rhBMP‑7 (BMP7) at early and intermediate time points (days 0–3, 10–13 and 14–17).
units.rationale: Tests the effect of diverse morphogen regimes on regional patterning.

units.title: Gradient Delivery Methods
units.text: We applied concentration gradients in microfluidic chips or increasing static concentrations in multi-well plates and observe different patterning dynamics in each scenario.
units.rationale: Compares spatial versus bulk morphogen delivery.

units.title: Quantifying Cell‑Type Diversity
units.text: We measured the heterogeneity of each patterning condition at multiple time points, concentrations and combinations, and use the Shannon diversity index, where lower scores indicate lower cell‑type diversity.
units.rationale: Provides a metric to assess compositional homogeneity.

units.title: In Situ Hybridization Chain Reaction Validation
units.text: In situ hybridization chain reaction (HCR) stainings confirmed the presence of more retinal progenitors (SFRP2+) at lower RA concentrations and more ventralized and posterior fates (FOXA2+) at higher RA concentrations (Fig. 2d and Extended Data Fig. 3l,m).
units.rationale: Validates scRNA‑seq findings at the protein level.

units.title: Data Integration and Visualization
units.text: We integrated the data using reference similarity spectrum (RSS) and embedded the dataset with uniform manifold approximation and projection (UMAP).
units.rationale: Allows comparison to a human brain reference atlas and visual exploration of cell states.
